item.title: Blocking Drive way and access to home and garage., 3rd November
item.description:
I informed the neighbour that I would need access during mid October and November. Skip has been in place since August without request or notice to me and two other properties that hold shared access. I'm now unable to move home as the occupants of the first house on Abbott way is extremely aggressive and I've had to ask for permission for her to remove her car for.me to even walk up the driveway. She's refusing to move the skip after her work mem said it would be gone by 20th October.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbots Way, Upper Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain, 3rd November
item.description:
Drain on the pavement is continuously rejecting water onto the street . The water flows onto the pedestrian walkway daily, creating wet patches and an unpleasant smell.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 104-106, Long Acre, Bloomsbury, City of Westminster

item.title: Foliage never cleared from footpath, 3rd November
item.description:

item.title: Disgusting litter all weekend, 3rd November
item.description:
..because of the commercial waste from Micky’s THAT WAS NOT PICKED UP AGAIN!!!! Everyone has chucked litter here and the bags have been ripped open by foxes. Every single weekend. Can’t something be done.??? It’s still the same this morning.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Speed bumt at entrance to Princess Road from Regents Park Road, 3rd November
item.description:
I reported this a few days ago as 8357922. This morning I received a message that a team had been dispatched and the issue was fixed. It in't. Setts and lintels are still loose. The adjacent tarmac is also cracking. This will only get worse rapidly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Road, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footway in Hayes lane junction with mead way covered in accumulated leaves. These are a serious hazard to walkers and disabled, 3rd November
item.description:
As above .large acumullaionof leaves ion the public footway in Hayes lane and the bus stop junction with mead way causing serious hazard to disabled persons and walkers generally.These leaves come from large trees onead way and have been collecting for the last three weeks on the footway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayes Lane, Hayes, London
